Description: Small fragment of a scarab, made of steatite, parts of the base and side are preserved. Fine details carved, whitish-beige colour, no glaze preserved. Longitudinal perforation visible, not finished, probably broken while drilling it. One leg and base line visible at the site in relief. The seal at the base shows a very fine oval line framing the base. In the middle part of a smA-tAwi sign preserved, to the left of it another unidentified sign, it shows an oval shape with inner lines in half circles and triangles. High quality.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), Site C: ‘extreme north end of’
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 233)
